posts.name:
Anthony Wentzel
Anthony Wentzel
posts.content:
The Day I Decided to Become a Fractional CTO 

I left the security of full-time employment behind and embraced the uncertain world of consulting.

A decision that had me second-guessing every step initially.

At first, the shift was pants-changingly intense:

 I had to find my own work, transitioning from an employee to essentially a consultant.

 Networking non-stop 

 Setting up processes from scratch 

 Marketing my expertise to potential clients 

My inner dialogue was cranking:

 Wondering if I‚Äôd made a monumental mistake.

 Wondering if I was going to be able to pay my bills.

 Realization hit‚Ä¶ much of my previous work had been project-based, more 'contractual' than 'permanent'.

Ô∏è Slowly, I began to see the potential unfold.

I realized my skills were not just needed but highly valued. Pineapple Corp began to take shape, growing from a bold gamble into a thriving business.

 Now, Pineapple Corp stands as a testament to taking risks.

It's been a journey from uncertainty to success, proving that you can't win big if you're not willing to put something on the table.

If you're standing at a crossroads, wondering if the risk is worth the reward, let my story inspire you. 

Got a story of a big career switch?

Or thinking about one?

Share some insight and encouragement! Ô∏è

comments.commentText: Pineapple Corp is living proof that the risk pays off.
Anthony Wentzel, your journey shows that calculated risks often lead to unexpected rewards.

posts.name:
Rutul Vadadoriya
Rutul Vadadoriya
posts.content:
Many hesitate to take the plunge. 

Whether it‚Äôs a business idea, a fitness routine, or a new skill,

the fear of failure holds us back.

Perfection isn‚Äôt the goal.

Progress is.

Every great achievement begins with a small step,

even when the path isn't clear.

Here‚Äôs the challenge:

‚Üí Start today.
‚Üí Start messy.
‚Üí Start scared.

No matter how small the beginning,

it‚Äôs a step closer to the finish line.

 What will you start today?

NEW -- ACT FAST TO BLUNT THIS NEW RANSOMWARE ATTACK: A threat actor is leveraging AWS‚Äôs own encryption against victim firms with no way out except paying for decryption keys.

The target is Amazon S3 buckets and the attack uses AWS‚Äô own
to make data virtually unrecoverable without paying the attackers for a decryption key.

‚ÄúWith no known method to recover the data without paying the ransom, this tactic represents a significant evolution in ransomware capabilities. If this method becomes widespread, it could pose a systemic threat to organizations using Amazon S3 for critical data storage,‚Äù the report adds.

posts.content:
Everyday Heroes Among Us 

ùëÜùëúùëöùëíùë°ùëñùëöùëíùë†, ùë°‚Ñéùëí ùëîùëüùëíùëéùë°ùëíùë†ùë° ‚Ñéùëíùëüùëúùëíùë† ùëéùëüùëí ùëõùëúùë° ùë°‚Ñéùëí ùëúùëõùëíùë† ùë§ùëí ùë†ùëíùëí ùëñùëõ ùëöùëúùë£ùëñùëíùë†; ùë°‚Ñéùëíùë¶ ùëéùëüùëí ùë°‚Ñéùëí ùëùùëéùëüùëíùëõùë°ùë† ùë§‚Ñéùëú ùëîùëú ùëéùëèùëúùë£ùëí ùëéùëõùëë ùëèùëíùë¶ùëõùëë ùëìùëúùëü ùë°‚Ñéùëíùëñùëü ùëê‚Ñéùëñùëôùëëùëüùëíùëõ.

This is a beautiful story of a father dressing up as Spiderman to surprise his son, who is bravely fighting cancer. On his child's birthday, he turned a simple moment into an unforgettable memory, showing us how far a parent's love can go to bring joy and hope.

There are parents like this who remind us that real strength is in care, kindness, and the will to do whatever it takes to make their loved ones happy.

 ùóüùó≤ùòÅ'ùòÄ ùóñùó≤ùóπùó≤ùóØùóøùóÆùòÅùó≤ ùó•ùó≤ùóÆùóπ-ùóüùó∂ùó≥ùó≤ ùó¶ùòÇùóΩùó≤ùóøùóµùó≤ùóøùóºùó≤ùòÄ 
Let us take a pause and celebrate these everyday heroes whose actions might appear small but leave an immeasurable impact.

 ùó™ùóµùóÆùòÅ‚ÄôùòÄ ùó¨ùóºùòÇùóø ùó†ùóºùó∫ùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùóºùó≥ ùóúùóªùòÄùóΩùó∂ùóøùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª? 
What's the moment of love or care that inspired you? Share your stories in the comments to help spread more positive vibes.

Follow me for more inspiring stories like this!

comments.commentText: What a touching story, Jerry! It‚Äôs amazing how simple acts of love and courage can create such profound moments. Celebrating these everyday heroes truly inspires us to spread kindness and positivity in our own lives. Thank you for sharing this beautiful reminder!

I appreciate your focus on everyday heroes who demonstrate kindness. It's essential for leaders to cultivate an atmosphere where such values are celebrated, ultimately driving collaboration and innovation.

posts.name:
Brad Hobbs, Ph.D.
Brad Hobbs, Ph.D.
posts.content:
I have honest, clarifying conversations for a living. 

We help leaders see blind spots and teams navigate unseen challenges that require change. Most of the time, we have to share hard truths with clarity and kindness. After hundreds of conversations with leaders, here are two simple things I've learned in preparing for those conversations.

Timing and Emotional readiness are the keys to impactful dialogue, especially when the stakes are high.

Here‚Äôs a framework I‚Äôve developed to prepare for hard conversations:

 Find the Right Tension: Timing matters. To create meaningful change, the conversation must happen when both parties can fully engage and fight/flight is not already active.
Ô∏è Too Late: Diminished Impact
Ô∏è Too Soon: Damaging Impact

Timing can be in 5 minutes or 5 weeks, but you must find a time when the person receiving the message can embrace the message's weight and take the appropriate action.

Ô∏è Hard Conversations without action = pointless conflict

 Process the Emotional Journey: Without imagining the emotional flow of the conversation beforehand, I've often caught myself blindsided or, worse, unempathetic to what the other person might feel or take away from the conversation.

Ô∏è Intentionally creates an opportunity for empathy to build credibility

If you ever need help from an outside voice or objective insight let us know.

comments.commentText: You are a master at this!
Kevin Miller, you're kind. It has definitely caused some premature greying in my hair.

posts.name:
Anupam Mittal
Anupam Mittal
posts.content:
Being fast and being busy will not make you win in life. I learnt it the hard way 

For years, I confused activity with progress.

I packed my calendar full, crammed in meetings, and tackled endless to-do lists. It felt like I was moving, but in reality, I was just spinning wheels.

I thought,
Progress = Activity

But it wasn‚Äôt 

In reality,
Progress = Velocity.

Where Velocity = Speed √ó Direction.

But we tend to forget that Speed is only valuable when it‚Äôs applied in the right direction.

That is why, as professionals, leaders & founders, it is so critical to step back and continually examine our priorities.

What do I specifically do? I block 2 hours every Saturday for "thinking time." No distractions. No calls. No emails. Just a ruthless focus on direction.

I use a SWOT framework to review the direction of my business, family, health, and life‚Äîthe BIG stuff that really matters.

The result > I went from frustrated to focussed. It‚Äôs been a game changer in achieving goals I felt were slipping away 

So now, I‚Äôm the merciless axe-man, sharpening the needle, instead of moving it in circles 

You?

comments.commentText:
Anupam Mittal Sir, your insights on differentiating activity from progress resonate deeply.
 It's easy to get lost in a whirlwind of tasks while neglecting what truly drives value. Your practice of dedicated thinking time and using a structured framework is a powerful reminder of the importance of focus and direction in our journey toward meaningful goals.
Thank you for sharing this valuable lesson.

posts.name:
Jordan Wilson
Jordan Wilson
posts.content:
ChatGPT Tasks 

 ChatGPT Actions 

Everyone (OpenAI included) missed on this.

Tasks are thought of as a do-list/reminder system.
Actions are when something is done.

BIG difference.

Even "smart" AI people online were comparing Tasks to a Calendar, when there's actually/literally zero calendar component.

These tasks are baby steps toward Agentic AI. (And Operator)

Agree or nah?

PS. (We laid out what is LITERALLY the best how-to on the Internet yesterday in our free email newsletter how to properly use them, and an additional free guide that's a legit gold mine. Check the link for more on that.)


==

Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
posts.content:
ALARMING IS AN UNDERSTATEMENT: The bad guys treasure such large collections, because aggregated data allows for a wide range of attacks, including identity theft, sophisticated phishing schemes, targeted cyberattacks, and unauthorized access to personal and sensitive accounts.

An exposed database comprising 1.5 billion records covering numerous companies across different economic and social sectors. One uniting feature, however, is that victims are mostly Chinese citizens, making this discovery among the biggest of its kind.

‚ÄúSaying the magnitude of this leak is alarming is an understatement. The leaks‚Äô volume alone is mind-boggling. Worse so, the exposed server had data from essential sectors like healthcare and finance, amplifying the potential harm,‚Äù researchers said.

comments.commentText: Scheint in China gibt es auch noch M√∂glichkeiten die IT-Sicherheit zu verbessern.
